intro: Pentacalia dodsonii, commonly known as the Dodson's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
